description: Open any folder in the Windows Subsystem for Linux (WSL) and take advantage of Visual Studio Code's full feature set.
settings.remote.WSL.fileWatcher.polling: If set, polling is used for file watching inside WSL1. Polling can be CPU intensive but fixes the WSL1 issue that folders can not be renamed when watched. This option requires restart to take effect.
settings.remote.WSL.fileWatcher.pollingI:
The file watcher polling interval in ms used inside WSL1 distros if `remote.WSL.fileWatcher.polling` is set.
This option requires restart to take effect.
settings.remote.WSL.debug: If set, the output in the WSL log shows debug information.
settings.remote.WSL.useShellEnvironment: If set, the WSL windows gets the environment from the shell it was opened from.
settings.remote.WSL.server.connectThroug: If set, the connection to a VS Code server running in WSL2 will use localhost (::1). If not set, the connection will directly use the WSL2 VM's IP addresss if accessible or localhost if not.
settings.remote.WSL1.connectionMethod: Specifies how Remote - WSL will connect to the VS Code server running in WSL1 distros. This option requires restart to take effect.
settings.remote.WSL1.connectionMethod.lo: Connects to the server in WSL though 127.0.0.1 which is beeing shared between Windows and WSL1.
settings.remote.WSL1.connectionMethod.ws: Connects to the server in WSL through a local proxy server that uses 'wsl.exe' to forward the connection to WSL.
settings.remote.WSL2.connectionMethod: Specifies how Remote - WSL will connect to the VS Code server running in WSL2 distros. This option requires restart to take effect.
settings.remote.WSL2.connectionMethod.lo: Connects to the server in WSL though localhost (::1) which is forwarded to the WSL2 VM by Windows.
settings.remote.WSL2.connectionMethod.ws: Connects to the server in WSL though the IP address of the WSL2 VM.
Connects to the server in WSL through a local proxy server that uses 'wsl.exe' to forward the connection to WSL.
walkthrough.title: Get Started with Remote - WSL
walkthrough.exploreCommands.title: Get Started with Remote - WSL

walkthrough.exploreCommands.description.message:
Remote - WSL adds several commands to VS Code. 
You can bring them up by pressing ``F1`` to open the Command Palette and typing inâ€¯"Remote-WSL." 
You can also open the set of remote commands through the green remote indicator in the lower left of VS Code. 
[Open the Remote Menu](command:workbench.action.remote.showMenu)
comment: Do not translate what's inside of the '(..)'. It is an internal command syntax for VS Code

walkthrough.exploreCommands.imageAltText: An image of Remote - WSL commands.
walkthrough.openWindow.title: Open a Remote - WSL Window

walkthrough.openWindow.description.message:
To take advantage of Remote - WSL, connect to a distro in a Remote - WSL window, where your Linux code will run on a local server. 
 You'll also be able to continue with the next steps of the WSL getting started experience! 
[New WSL Window](command:remote-wsl.newWindow)
comment: Do not translate what's inside of the '(..)'. It is an internal command syntax for VS Code

walkthrough.openWindow.imageAltText: An image of a new Remote - WSL window.
walkthrough.createProject.title: New to WSL? Create a project folder.

walkthrough.createProject.description.message:
WSL has its own file system, with [performance](https://docs.microsoft.com/windows/wsl/compare-versions#performance-across-os-file-systems) advantages for creating and accessing your projects. 
In VS Code, you can use Remote - WSL to open and edit this project. 
[Learn how](https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/remote/wsl-tutorial) to create your first app within WSL. 
[Create a new file in the WSL file system](command:explorer.newFile)
comment: Do not translate what's inside of the '(..)'. It is an internal command syntax for VS Code

walkthrough.openProject.title: Have a project? Open it in WSL.

walkthrough.openProject.description.message:
Once you have a project in the WSL file system, you can open it directly in VS Code. 
[Open Folder in WSL](command:remote-wsl.openFolder)
comment: Do not translate what's inside of the '(..)'. It is an internal command syntax for VS Code

walkthrough.linuxEnv.title: A real Linux environment

walkthrough.linuxEnv.description.message:
Remote - WSL runs commands using a real Linux kernel. 
Running ``uname`` in a Remote - WSL terminal shows you're in a Linux environment. 
[Open a terminal and try out Linux commands](command:workbench.action.terminal.focus)
comment: Do not translate what's inside of the '(..)'. It is an internal command syntax for VS Code

walkthrough.installTools.title: Install Tools

walkthrough.installTools.description.message:
To get rich editing and debugging experiences, install the languages, toolsets, and VS Code extensions for your project in WSL. 
[Install Extensions in WSL](command:workbench.view.extensions)
comment: Do not translate what's inside of the '(..)'. It is an internal command syntax for VS Code

walkthrough.runDebug.title: Run and Debug

walkthrough.runDebug.description.message:
Remote - WSL makes it easy to run and debug your Linux apps. 
Use the run and debug view or ``F5`` to run your app. You can set breakpoints, inspect variables, and navigate the call stack. 
[Open the run and debug view](command:workbench.view.debug)
comment: Do not translate what's inside of the '(..)'. It is an internal command syntax for VS Code

walkthrough.comeBack.title: Come back anytime
walkthrough.comeBack.description:
You can easily return to a VS Code Remote - WSL session anytime by executing ``code .`` in a WSL terminal.
 VS Code will launch automatically connected to Remote - WSL.
walkthrough.comeBack.imageAltText: External terminal running the code . command
